verses.roman:
tayor āsanam ādāya
pādayor avanijya ca
arhaṇenānulepena
dhūpa-mālyair apūjayat

synonyms: tayoḥ—to Them; āsanam—sitting places; ādāya—offering; pādayoḥ—Their feet; avanijya—hathing; ca—and; arhaṇena—with suitable respectful offerings; anulepena—by anointing Them with sandalwood pulp and other fragrant substances; dhūpa—with incense; mālyaiḥ—and flower garlands; apūjayat—he worshiped.
translation: He gave Them sitting places and washed Their feet, and then he worshiped Them with presentations of arghya, sandalwood pulp, fragrant oils, incense and flower garlands.
